greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(1) = 1; for n > 1, a(n) = smallest even number not already in sequence such a(1) + ... + a(n) is a prime.
comment: Essentially the same as A054408. [_R. J. Mathar_, Dec 15 2008]
Conjecture: Every even numbers appears. - _N. J. A. Sloane_, May 29 2017
link: Chai Wah Wu, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000 (terms n = 1..4097 from N. J. A. Sloane).
mathematica: t = {1}; Do[i = 2; While[! PrimeQ[Total[t] + i] || MemberQ[t, i], i += 2]; AppendTo[t, i], {65}]; t (* _Jayanta Basu_, Jul 04 2013 *)
xref: See A055265 for a version where the sums of two adjacent terms are primes.
results.author: _Amarnath Murthy_, Aug 10 2002
ext: Offset corrected by _Chai Wah Wu_, Aug 27 2017
